Read my full statement on the United Nations vote on Iran today: http://www.gardner.senate.gov/content/gardner-iran-un-vote-i-condemn-administrations-action-strongest-possible-terms …
Congress must fully review this agreement before the Administration grants Iran those concessions.
The Iranian regime has waited years for a lifted arms embargo, allowing them to buy more weapons for Hamas and Hezbollah to aim at Israel.
The Iranian regime has waited years to receive the billions in frozen offshore accounts which they can use to fund international terror.
The Iranian regime has waited years for the international nuclear legitimacy which the Obama Administration seems determined to grant them.
The American people & representatives in Congress have 60 days to review this deal, agreed to in the Iran Nuclear Agreement Review Act.
Coming on the heels of the Administration's seemingly endless concession-granting to the Iranians in Vienna, this UN action is unacceptable.
The Administration pattern: mislead the Congress, avoid the American people, and use extraconstitutional actions to advance their Iran deal.
I condemn the Administration’s decision to take their Iran deal to the UN before the US Congress in the strongest possible terms.
Today's UN vote sets the stage for sanctions against Iran to be lifted and Iran’s considerable ledger of past violations to be wiped clean.
Seemingly, the Administration would rather run to UN bureaucrats for rubber-stamp approval than make the case for their deal on its merits.
The Administration’s decision to take the Iran nuclear agreement to the UN before the US Congress is a grave mistake.

The American people deserve to know what the Obama Administration knows about the #OPMHack, and precisely what they're doing about it.
There's ample precedent. In 2014, DoJ indicted 5 PLA officers for cyber espionage. Take a similar approach on #OPMHack
WH Exec Order 13694 can impose sanctions against entities which threaten US NatSec or economic/financial health via cyber. Use it. #OPMHack
And what is the plan to prevent the next #OPMHack? It's been months. The American people deserve to know.
What is the plan to hold the individuals or entities who perpetrated the #OPMHack accountable? Indictments? Sanctions?
Has the #OPMHack been raised with the PRC’s ambassador to the US? Was it raised at the US-China Strategic & Economic dialogue last month?
If China is involved, as suggested in reports, what diplomatic efforts is the Administration taking? If none, why? What's the delay?
What does the Administration know about who hacked our government? Are they ever planning on informing Americans?
How soon after the breach did the administration ID the perpetrators and/or state sponsors? Why don’t we know this already?
Missing on #OPMHack? Discussion of the perpetrators. Admin officials go on background with reporters to accuse China. Publicly? Nothing.
The Administration now, after 3 months, says 22 million are affected. Other reports put the number higher. A massive, unprecedented breach.
The Obama Administration response to the #OPMHack has been lacking on multiple fronts.
